climbs.name: We Bean Jammin' aka Eat The Rich

content.description: Step off the block in the drainage gully and clip a bolt that leads you up a low angle ramp/dihedral. A little confusing as to what Rick was looking for here. Clips are on the wall, however, we used the ramp on the right since climbing the face seemed loads harder than 5.11. Make a hard move off a deep jam for the super-protected crux and finish on an improbable fin. Cool move at the end.
content.protection: Six draws, something for the top, and a rope.

content.description: Step off a block in the drainage gully to clip a high first bolt. Tricky moves passing the second clip yield to a powerful dyno or a subtle jam. Run up on killer jugs to a short, delicate and balancey move just before the anchor. Unfortunately, some the most interesting moves are made on flakes and features that will not have unlimited longevity. So pull with care to keep these features on the wall. The nifty sequence at the end can be avoided either to the left or the right. However, with the final clip well above your chest when pulling the move, why cheat yourself? Nothing but air if you miss the dyno. Fun and well protected.
content.protection: Seven draws, something for the top, and a rope.

content.description: Follow a line of bolts up the left side of the Bean Liquor Wall. Hambanger starts with some moves on a short face to gain a slot and eventually chases an arete to the top of the crag. Nice, well protected moves to an interesting sequence on the arete. Felt more like 10a/b than 10d (5.10d in Rolofson's guide).

Furthest route on the right. Starts off a nice stance in the gully. I felt like giving this a Bomb rating, but the bomb was me. First move off the deck felt like 5.10, not 5.11c as indicated in Rolofson's guide, so things should have been smooth sailing. Even clipping draws already in place, this route felt awkward and weird. Funky moves on a steep, angling roof lead to a painful jam and another awkward swim to a ledge and the anchor. I had no fun, but if you suss it out from the get-go it's probably decent.
content.protection: Five draws, something for the double bolt anchor, and a rope.

content.description:
This is a good climb with some interesting moves. This route starts with a few hard moves to reach and then to pass the first bolt, then cruises up past some more bolts and the true crux, continuing to the top of the arete, or wherever you decide to belay.  The crux is pulling up on slopers on a shelf at mid-route and is 5.11.

Take some gear from 3/4" to 3" to belay from, as there is no anchor up top.
content.protection:
Several bolts to a topout and belay on gear. A set of cams and a few nuts or tricams will make the belay and protect any path to it.

Climb back down to rap from the anchors on

Hambanger

after the real climbing is over.
content.location:
This route is the bolted arete left of

Hambanger

, on the "Bean Liquor Wall" (upper West face of Bell Buttress, up a gully).
